citations.desc: Institutional Animal Care and Use Committee (IACUC).
citations.narrative:
The Institutional Animal Care and Use Committee's (IACUC) official reports of the semi-annual evaluations to the
Institutional Official (IO) are not reviewed and signed by a majority of the IACUC. The semi-annual facility inspection was
conducted on 27 March 2025 and sent to the IO on 21 April 2025, however, did not include signatures from the majority of
the IACUC members. The facility utilized the spring IACUC meeting minutes to serve as the official report of the semi-
annual evaluation of the facility’s humane care and use program. The meeting was held on 25 April 2025 and the
documented meeting minutes were sent to the IO on 2 June 2025, and again did not include signatures from the majority
of the IACUC members.
Reports submitted to the IO shall be reviewed and signed by a majority of the IACUC members to confirm agreement with
the inspection findings. Failure of a majority of the IACUC members to review the findings and sign the report could lead
to the omission of a minority view or a deficiency in the facility's animal use program or facility inspection.
The IACUC shall prepare evaluation reports at least once every six months upon completion of the required semiannual
evaluations which are reviewed and signed by a majority of the IACUC members. The report must identify all deficiencies,
designate each as significant or minor and contain a reasonable and specific plan and schedule with dates for correcting
each deficiency.
Correct by 30 October 2025 or by the next facility semi-annual evaluation.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the facility representative.
n

narrative:
2.31(c)(3) 
   
Institutional Animal Care and Use Committee (IACUC). 
The Institutional Animal Care and Use Committee's (IACUC) official reports of the semi-annual evaluations to the 
Institutional Official (IO) are not reviewed and signed by a majority of the IACUC. The semi-annual facility inspection was 
conducted on 27 March 2025 and sent to the IO on 21 April 2025, however, did not include signatures from the majority of 
the IACUC members. The facility utilized the spring IACUC meeting minutes to serve as the official report of the semi-
annual evaluation of the facility’s humane care and use program. The meeting was held on 25 April 2025 and the 
documented meeting minutes were sent to the IO on 2 June 2025, and again did not include signatures from the majority 
of the IACUC members. 
 
Reports submitted to the IO shall be reviewed and signed by a majority of the IACUC members to confirm agreement with 
the inspection findings. Failure of a majority of the IACUC members to review the findings and sign the report could lead 
to the omission of a minority view or a deficiency in the facility's animal use program or facility inspection. 
 
The IACUC shall prepare evaluation reports at least once every six months upon completion of the required semiannual 
evaluations which are reviewed and signed by a majority of the IACUC members. The report must identify all deficiencies, 
designate each as significant or minor and contain a reasonable and specific plan and schedule with dates for correcting 
each deficiency.  
Correct by 30 October 2025 or by the next facility semi-annual evaluation. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the facility representative.
